question: [File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: BootstrapNotComplete] [Liveness dependency] Can validators become permanently stuck in BootstrapNotComplete state if bootstrap fails, causing total loss of liveness without recovery mechanism? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: UnsatisfiableWaypoint] [Trust anchor bypass] Can the UnsatisfiableWaypoint error (lines 52-53) be triggered incorrectly to reject valid waypoints, or can invalid waypoints bypass verification without triggering this error? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: UnsatisfiableWaypoint] [Chain split] If UnsatisfiableWaypoint is returned during bootstrap, can this cause validators to fork onto different chains if they have inconsistent waypoint configurations? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: UnsatisfiableWaypoint] [Merkle proof manipulation] Does UnsatisfiableWaypoint properly validate all Merkle proof components when checking waypoint satisfiability, or can attackers provide partial proofs that bypass verification? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: UnsatisfiableWaypoint] [Error recovery] Can validators recover from UnsatisfiableWaypoint errors during sync, or does this error cause permanent bootstrap failure requiring manual intervention? (High)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: InvalidPayload] [Malformed data] Can the InvalidPayload error (lines 30-31) be bypassed by crafting specially formatted payloads that pass initial validation but cause corruption during later processing? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: InvalidPayload] [Deserialization attack] Does InvalidPayload catch all malformed payload deserializations, or can attackers trigger panics/crashes with malicious payloads that bypass this error check? (High)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: InvalidPayload] [Consensus payload] Can InvalidPayload errors during consensus sync lead to validators rejecting legitimate blocks, causing consensus liveness issues or safety violations? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: InvalidPayload] [Type confusion] Are payload type validations comprehensive enough to prevent type confusion attacks where one payload type is misinterpreted as another, bypassing InvalidPayload checks? (High)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: AdvertisedDataError] [Peer manipulation] Can malicious peers advertise incorrect data ranges (triggering AdvertisedDataError on lines 14-15) to cause validators to request wrong data and desync from the network? (High)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: AdvertisedDataError] [Data availability attack] Can attackers exploit AdvertisedDataError by advertising data they don't actually have, causing validators to waste resources retrying invalid sync attempts? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: AdvertisedDataError] [Version range manipulation] Does AdvertisedDataError properly validate advertised version ranges to prevent attacks where peers claim to have data for impossible version ranges? (High)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: CriticalDataStreamTimeout] [Liveness failure] Can CriticalDataStreamTimeout errors (lines 20-21) accumulate to permanently halt state sync if all data streams consistently timeout, causing total loss of liveness? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: CriticalDataStreamTimeout] [Timeout manipulation] Can malicious peers deliberately delay responses to trigger CriticalDataStreamTimeout, forcing validators to repeatedly restart sync and never make progress? (High)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: CriticalDataStreamTimeout] [Threshold attack] What is the threshold for 'too many times' in CriticalDataStreamTimeout, and can attackers stay just below this threshold to maximize disruption without triggering the error? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: DataStreamNotificationTimeout] [Notification starvation] Can DataStreamNotificationTimeout errors (lines 22-23) be triggered by slow validators or network issues, causing unnecessary sync restarts that degrade performance? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: DataStreamNotificationTimeout] [Concurrent streams] Does DataStreamNotificationTimeout properly track timeouts per stream, or can timeout in one stream incorrectly trigger errors for other healthy streams? (High)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: FullNodeConsensusNotification] [Node type confusion] Can the FullNodeConsensusNotification error (lines 26-27) be bypassed by malicious code that sends consensus notifications to full nodes despite the check, potentially causing state corruption? (High)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: FullNodeConsensusNotification] [Type enforcement] Is the full node vs validator distinction properly enforced before consensus notifications are processed, or can type confusion allow this error to be bypassed? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: FullNodeConsensusNotification] [Configuration attack] Can attackers manipulate node configuration to make validators act as full nodes or vice versa, bypassing FullNodeConsensusNotification checks and causing consensus violations? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: EventNotificationError] [Event subscription attack] Can EventNotificationError (lines 24-25) be triggered by malicious event producers flooding the notification system, causing state sync to fail? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: EventNotificationError] [Notification loss] If EventNotificationError occurs, can critical state sync events be lost, causing validators to miss important consensus updates? (High)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: CallbackSendFailed] [Response loss] Can CallbackSendFailed errors (lines 18-19) cause consensus sync requests to be lost without proper retry, leading to validators becoming desynchronized? (High)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: CallbackSendFailed] [Deadlock potential] Can CallbackSendFailed occur during critical consensus operations in ways that cause deadlocks or permanent hangs if the receiver is waiting for the callback? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/error.rs] [Enum Variant: CallbackSendFailed] [Error propagation] Does CallbackSendFailed properly propagate to consensus to notify it of sync failures, or can callbacks fail silently causing consensus to wait indefinitely? (High)
